turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: You like it? Irrigation system. Your grandaddy built it himself. Saved the land from dying.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's a good idea. Maybe we should have a little "talk" about grandaddy Jethro.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Sure. What do you want to know.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: People say he was a murderer.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: That's your grandfather you're talking about!  I... know what people say. Heard it... all my life.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Then who?! Because someone wants another blood harvest. With human blood, Jeremiah! Just like Jethro! Who did he kill back then, Jeremiah? Farmhands? Transients? People no one would miss? "Crazy Old Macdonald!" But now... it's starting again, isn't it? Someone's picking up where Jethro left off!

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: -- It's not me!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Who then, Jeremiah?? -- Who?!

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: It's time to make amends.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Amends...?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Think boy. That night. The night of the fire. At the barn. You were only six years old.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Throw me one.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Not while you're driving.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: -- And keep your eyes on the road.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm admiring your costume. What "movie" are you going as again?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Sheena, Queen of the Jungle.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Never heard of it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm not surprised. It's got a body count of zero. And no one goes around in a stupid mask, hacking innocent people to death.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You don't like my costume? Cool. I'll go with plan B. Which one you like better?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Is that all you ever think of? Suppose I was really hurt!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Dammit, Karen -- I was just... looking for your pulse.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: -- By way of my breasts?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Ow!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Nothing. I'll have us back on the road in no time.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey -- Macdonald's farm!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ray -- I'd like to get to the club sometime before dawn.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Jesus. What a bunch of useless zombies.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Who? Us?!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: The audience!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Hey. Could you be a little more insensitive? We're on our way to a funeral for Crissake.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah. Our own. I don't see why we got to go along for the ride.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You know what they say about men who need big guns...

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Hey. Some Klu Klux Klan homeboy gets in my face, he gonna have a few extra holes in his bedsheet.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Down boy.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Who you callin' "boy?"

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah. Maybe I can pick a little cotton for da masta.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You got something against farm people, Keith?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Not at all. They lynched my ancestors, they smell like manure, they have sex with their relatives... and they all have two first names: "Bobby- Joe" --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: It's a farm, Keith. You're not supposed to shoot the rooster.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: He started it.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You seen Mac? His bed hasn't been slept in.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: What?! You mean... I slept on this couch for nothing?!

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Hallelujah! ...Civilization... here I come!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Amen.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: What the fuck you talking about, man?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He's right. You were behind.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Asphyxiation. Choked to death on a ham sandwich. Next.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Buzzzzzzzzzz. Sorry, wrong answer!

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Chicken sandwich?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Bzzzzzzzzzt!

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Fuck you! Who cares what sandwich the bitch was eating?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: You wanna know the difference? The difference is that you're screwing up the song.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Yeah. Sure. I'm screwing up the song. You're the one who's been two beats behind since we kicked it off.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Relax. He liked what he saw. Well, some of it. Enough to give us a showcase audition. One week from today.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Which means we've got ONE week to start acting like a professional band.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Try taking a left after the next cow pasture.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah. That sounds good. "Hang a left at the first cow patty, then make a right when you see porky pig".

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah. That's just the problem.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Tell me you checked the bus before we left, Carl.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You guys figure it out. I'm taking a break.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah. Good idea. Go milk the cows, feed the chickens.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: How does it feel, Keith?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Fuck you! Fuck all of you! I'm done kickin' it with cows and roosters. -- And drinking moonshine with Johnny Cash! Senior AND Junior!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yeah, that's right! I'm outta here -- Y'all can kiss my city ass goodbye!... I'm gone with the wind.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Time for a little... "feedback" guys. That guy from Hectic Records --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: -- picked tonight to come by and watch our set.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You never told us you grew up on a farm.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Nothing to tell.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: My father and I don't exactly see eye to eye.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Name something.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Then why go back now?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Still trying to figure it out myself.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What about Jeremiah?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Nah. Just you.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: This... used to be Jethro's room. The attic.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: When I was a kid... I was never allowed up here...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I'm talking to the spirit of Jethro Macdonald. Is it okay to have sex in your old attic with your grandson? We'll be careful of the bed --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Let it go.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I bet if he were still alive, he'd like to watch.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Think of it... as a threesome. You. Me. And... "Jethro."

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I said that's enough!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: We're almost ready. What the hell are you doing out here?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I... heard something... came in here last night. Must have gone to sleep.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: How'd you get that? Playing with your pitchfork?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Picked up one of those shears. Blade's razor sharp. -- Where is everyone?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Getting ready.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Look. You want to talk about this?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I don't think so. Keith's about to use the rooster for target practice. Besides... you didn't seem too interested last night.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Strange... I can feel my old self coming back...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Mmmm -- so can I...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You never had trouble communicating before.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Suzie --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Billy Bob's dead. -- We were wrong -- he didn't do anything. I-It's the scarecrow --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Wait a minute --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I... saw him -- he tried to kill me -- he's, he's -- still -- out there --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What are --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: HE'S STILL OUT THERE!!!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: -- You're not making sense!! What "Scarecrow"?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You're... limping.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I hurt my leg. Diving away from the Harvester -- it almost got me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Suzie... No.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: It's you. You and your father.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You brought us here. And that morning I found you in the barn. You had scratches on your face --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Listen to me --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You sabotaged the bus! You kept us here... To die! First Keith, then Carl --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Suzie --

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: No Mac, please... I --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't look.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Mac... let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't you see? Whatever's going on... I'm part of it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Get out of here.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: No. Not without you --

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The trap door. That's how he escaped the fire...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You've been... hiding him all these years. Helping him... irrigate the land. With blood...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: ...no... Mac... p-please...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Can't help it, Suze... family sticks together...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I almost thought for a second...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah. Great work, Rod. But next time, it would be nice... if you could JOIN US FOR THE ENTIRE SET!

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I was getting 'warmed' up.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Hey. Anyone here need lessons, just talk to me.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah, I'll teach you a lesson --

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: What is it?!!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Spider.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: She's a Tarot Card Reader at a shopping mall.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What a surprise. -- What about our audition?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Hold it, hold it. Aren't you forgetting something, Rod?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Like your guitar break.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: It's coming right up. After the third verse.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Second verse!

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Jeez, what's the difference? Just 'cause it's rock 'n roll, doesn't mean it's be set in stone.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: -- Where have you two been?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Us? We been... moonlighting.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Where's Mac?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Who knows? Just like a man... never around when you need them.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Carl.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: CARL??? Carl did this?!!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Last night... he tried to get it on with me.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Someone better tell Mac.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Why bother?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: It gets worse. He's cut all the phone lines.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What'll we do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bill, you're Chief of police now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Comes with some Goddamn responsibility, like keeping your people in line.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You're right, Jack. Margaret, you're fired.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bill, we need to talk!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: 'Mornin', Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bill, this Brenda's Randy Flagg's niece. We need to find Grant yesterday! The town council has lit a Roman candle and stuck it up my ass!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hell, Jack, your leisure activities ain't my business.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, Bill. Your post here as Chief is in dire straits you don't work this shit out.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How are you going to find him?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Dude's a half--squid. Ain't many places he can hide. Sea World, maybe.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That young lady heard you say 'squid.' She's gonna go out and create a Goddamn hysteria!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Sherry, you gonna create a hysteria?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Touch some deer feces out in the forest. Eat a sandwich without washing your hands. Then you got lyme disease.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: And that makes you look like a squid?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll tell you what, no one with lyme disease gonna win any damn handsome contests!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Don't worry. The lurker ain't around. I checked.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: That's not funny.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Whatcha' doin'?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Tryin' to get a buzz on. But I'm too buff. Too much muscle mass.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What you up to?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Just checking out the lights.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Pretty, ain't they?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I don't know. I've seen them so many times before. I guess any spot gets boring after awhile.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Well that's only if you're in the wrong spot.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: There's a place over there on the bluffs. When the fog is just right, like tonight, the lights of Main look like a kaleidoscope.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Mm hm. But only a few folks know how to get there. Wally. Rollo Linkski coulda taken you, but 'course he got hit by that train. Me.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I'll get Wally to show me sometime then.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant, where'd you go?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hey, Grant.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Maybe she's ever called the house, or -- ?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: No. WhatÂ…?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: She disappeared Friday night. We got reason to believe foul play might be involved.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: How about Brenda?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: New? No. We're hoping we find Grant, he'll lead us to her.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Bill, I heard what you're doing. I think I should go along.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Why? Listen, it doesn't matter. I gotta go.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Wait! Dammit, Bill, if that girl's still out there, how will you find her? How, unless you bring Grant in alive? Your best chance of doing that is with me. I can talk to him --

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: He tried to kill you, Starla.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: He did. I know. But I got him angry 'cause I wasn't calm. This time I could --

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Please, Bill. What happened, it's my fault, I know it.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Starla, it ain't --

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: It is. He'd been acting strange. And the physical changes. I should have told someone right away... But I was just blind. I wanted to pretend it wasn't happening... If I don't do what I can to help now, I just couldn't live with it.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: No reception out here.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Bill, I'll run out to your car, call for paramedics from there.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Was always curious why you... married Grant in the first place... Just never seemed outta love.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I know what people say, Bill. I... Remember, back in high school I worked at my father's gas station?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant used to get filled up every day. I knew it was just to see me. He was too old -- But he was handsome. And he had that big ol' Lincoln then. I flirted with him.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Well, big ol' Lincoln, sure. Guess I would have flirted with him too.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: My father, he was -- he was real close to evil. People didn't know. Still don't. From the time I was a toddler he'd beat the hell out of me. I don't mean just like a smack for smart--mouthing... he took a real enjoyment in it. And when I turned eleven or twelve, things... well, they got worse. Starla looks at Bill, who seems struck.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: When you wanted to run away, I called your dad.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: That wasn't a good night, no.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: After all this shit tonight, I know for sure now you regret not running off with me to Hollywood!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hell, Starla. I always regretted that.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What are you doing?!

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: We can't make it. Just get away, when you get the chance.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: He wants me, Bill! I'm going to get him to take me to him! See if you can follow me, and kill him!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: No, Starla! No!

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: We can probably get some first aid and food at this gas station up here.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah. Good.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I'll get it for you. Ibuprofen or aspirin?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Aspirin.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We'll just head up here into Bishopville, get checked up in the hospital. Then maybe we'll head off to Hollywood after all, huh?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Please, Starla. I'm gonna do my best not to hurt anybody --

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: You took Bill.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It's my nature.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: And this is mine.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What's she see in that douchebag?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: That's the mystery of the ages there, Trev. Starla was seventeen when they got engaged. He was, like, in his thirties. No one even knew they were goin' out till she had that ring on her finger.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: He's gotta be in the forest. All three ranches run alongside it.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Think we should get up a search party, head in there?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: And then we get here, the Castavets', where last night's shit--storm took place.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: I see. It's like as if he's going in a pattern. Is that what you're saying, Bill?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Where are you?!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: We're coming your way, man!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: He's a fucking Martian?!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: A Martian is from Mars, Trevor.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: When I buy my zoo, I'm leaving them things the hell out!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shelby!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: What the hell are we going to do?!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Just block the doors, any way you can.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Surprised you're able to lift a mug after carrying that torch for so long.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hey, Wally. Glad you're here. There was something I wanted to tell you...

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Oh yeah. Fuck you, fat ass.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Some kids found her necklace near Tipper Creek, as well as what might be her blood on a rock.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: The problem, Starla, is, the last person anyone saw her talking to was Grant.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Rorschach.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: What do you see? I see a butterfly.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Looks like a chipmunk.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Your momma wasn't too proud when you came out neither, Wally.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I think we best get you to a hospital right quick.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: What the fuck they gonna do with her in a hospital, Bill?

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: You dig that rat out of the hole?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Listen, you got any reports of... I don't know what you call 'em. They look like big slugs, only fast.

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Slugs? No. 'Less you talkin' about that new waitress down at Sloan's! Ha ha!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shelby --

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Oh, shit! I hope she ain't a police radio aficionado. If so, I apolog

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shelby, shut up. Keep an eye out for these things. If you see 'em, keep your mouth covered. Otherwise they'll go straight down it. All right?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Are you nodding?

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I can't hear when you're nodding.

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We'll be there in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shelby, we broke down on 22, a mile outside town. Come pick us up.

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: I got to leave my post.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Hey there, Chief.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shelby! We need people out here at Cosgrove and McCammon right away!

turns.speaker: SHELBY
turns.text: Don't worry, Chief.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Megan Halesy' little sister.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Shit. You're kidding me. Nope. BRENDA Brenda! GRANT Hell, you were --

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: My sister Megan, she's a big fat cow. Was then, even more so now. I'd be thinking, what'd you see in her ain't in me?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Shit, girl, you couldn't'a been eleven.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Hell, I was game!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Who's the lucky fella?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Fuck lucky. Never marry a damn half--Mexican.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Already ain't. Married a gal named --

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Starla Covington. Don't be ignorant. Everyone knows that. Fucking prom queen.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You're lookin' awful pretty.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Shut up.
